Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star hotel! The images speak for itself... Disappoitment.”
Reviews.Author: catalina_andra
Reviews.Content: Hello, We just got back from Italy, Venice and Verona, a couple a days ago. In Venice we stayed at this "hotel" called "LUX" (?!?) why I can't imagine because from the beginning of our arrival we were asked to live the primary building with the sign "Hotel Lux" and we were lead to ANOTHER BUILDING on another street, close but with an incredible smell and next door they were working on a building, you can only imagine the noise and the dust. I will let the images speak for it self, because it was a big disappoitment, the furniture is a mess although you can see it was once a beautiful furniture, the bed was made of twin beds put next to each other, although we had payed for a matrimonial room, the walls were dirty, so as a chair in the room, and the bathroom regarding the sanitary elements they were never changed and rusty. On high lows yes the hotel it's a few steps from Piazza San Marco, but it's not always a must, we could have stayed very well in other places too. they changed our towels daily and swept the room, made our bed properly, the breakfast was ok, only due to the nice lady that served us and asked us every morning what kind of coffee we prefer, from hot chocolate, capucino, caffe latte, dark coffee, hot milk. The hotel also has a free trip to the Murano Island each day from 09.30, but you have to announce a day earlier, we found out from somebody else because in our room the announcement was missing. Be careful it is a one way trip to a murano glass factory... called Gino Mazzuccato where if you are not interested in buying they treat you like a nobody, and here I refer to the gentlemen with dark hair, a front calvition and glasses, not a pleasant experience due to him. We choose this hotel because of the location, but... the photos will tell the story.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Duncan M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Lux for three nights as part of an Italian mini-holiday and we weren't disappointed. We had visited Venice before on a day trip and we realised that we wouldn't be staying in a large modern hotel (they don't do that sort of thing here). The hotel Lux is ideally situated for all of the major tourist spots - we were in the annex which is the next alley over from the Bridge of Sighs. The room was compact, slightly dingy and the air conditioning only blew out warm air (it's not too bad in March but could wind up our North American friends in the summer months-especially when the canal odours start to ripen) but hey, it added to the character and even the couple of flights of stairs doesn't matter unless you've brought as much luggage that'll require a team of Sherpas. The staff were friendly and very helpful, and on the last evening provided us with a carry out breakfast for our early flight on to Rome. The breakfast is typically continental - no fry ups here - although the dining salon is small and you have to catch it at the right time to avoid a wait. There are lots of nearby restaurants but we would recommend the Ristorante La Nuova Grotta which is just around the corner - great food and friendly staff- although a little bit pricey. Tell them that you're staying at the hotel Lux and they waive the service charge. All in all a good hotel to base yourself in for transport links, and of course the sights and sounds of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A good little place for those on a budget and want the sights on their doorstep.”
Reviews.Author: HubbysNumpty
Reviews.Content: Just a hop skip and and a jump from St Mark's Square and a two minute walk from the vaporetto stop (San Zaccaria) tucked in an alley but there is a sign half way up the main thoroughfare opposite the stop. Reception staff were friendly enough and check-in was efficient. Rooms were made up every day. For the deal that we paid for (which included return flights) the cost of the trip was a bargain. Room was ok and clean, although not gleaming but no bed bugs in our room which means I'm fairly happy. There was an ice sized bathroom but very thin wardrobe, Extra blankets and pillows were provided. We were on the 2nd floor and no window views but to be fair we were out most of the day anyway. The ceiling was a bit thin but only when the couple got fairly amorous above us - well it is the city of romance after all but generally no bother when they were quiet. There are no lifts and those that require special access i.e. if you're a wheelchair user will be out of luck. The stairs are also narrow. If you're on a weekend break, thoroughly recommend packing a daypack if you can manage it and wear all your bulky clothes if you're going in the winter season. We managed to and took all out toiletries in the travel sizes although sachets of shower gel and shampoo were provided. Breakfast was a bit basic, cereal, fruit juice, tea/coffee and a sad looking but edible croissant but if you're on a tight budget then more than enough to fill up on. No hot food provided. The breakfast room is small and you may have to wait for a table. Breakfast was 8am-10am. At the moment it is very cold so do wrap up warm but this meant that the hotel was very warm and cosy. The downside is that so was our room and we had no control over the temperature which meant it was sometimes a bit too stuffy to sleep well. If I was to return on a budget again I'd certainly look this place up given it's location and the fact that it's not too difficult to find (look up on google maps or something first :-) ).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and valur for money!”
Reviews.Author: tripadv83
Reviews.Content: Just walking distance from San Marco, room was nice & clean at a very affordable price. Definitely recommended. Only to be avoided if you are physically unfit or have special needs: series of steep staircases with no lift ( a common theme in venice though). Breakfast was ok but we had to wait for a free table (breakfast room is small)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: AdeleL885
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit tricky to find, but it was due more to the fact I can't read maps very well! The reception is in a different building to where I stayed, but honestly, that caused no problems, there was a phone in the room that could be used to contact reception if there were problems. The room was clean and well maintained, it was a bit small, but it was a single. The breakfast was a satisfactory continental breakfast (with a tasty cappucino). The location is briliant, it's one of the first casse's off the Grand Canale next Piazza San Marco. Talking to other holiday makers (during tours and since leaving there), I've discovered I was very spoilt with the position. The staff are friendly and helpful and the young man on reception even carried my suitcase up the stairs (one flight) without me even asking!!! I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel , not even 1.5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Dolly P
Reviews.Content: It took us a while to locate this hotel , yes close to St. Mark square just by the water. the hotel is very congested NO LIFT and we were allotted a 5th floor room ( which is by the way an attic forcibly converted into a room), It had stairs walking to the room @! we had to drag our heavy travel bags without lift to this room !. I requested the manager upon our arrival to give us room in the lower floor since we are carrying heavy luggage . However he denied of having any rooms available other than allotted to us . Later in evening on our way out we seen couple of rooms vacant. The room was very dingy , bad decor , stinking bed ! bad air-conditioning upon complaining they said its functioning fine without even making any attempts to correct it. I am comfortably quoting here of we being subject to racial discrimination ! I am very much considering of lodging a formal racial discrimination complaint to Italian embassy . Overall bad experience where the hotel and room is concern .

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was just as expected”
Reviews.Author: Ylnda
Reviews.Content: I wanted a hotel close to Saint Mark's square, at reasonable cost and that is what this is. Breakfast is adequate and we had a sweet room on the 4th floor (no lift that I was aware of) which had the bonus of a balcony - couldn't use it because of the rain! The room was very hot, and we did not find a regulator for the heating control. We spent the first night in a nearby hotel because an accident with a previous guest meant we were unable to get into our room. We were shown to the hotel, and Lux collected our bag the next day and put it in our room for when we came back from our site-seeing. If you don;t like stairs, don't book this hotel. If you are happy with stairs and want reasonable price and central location, no frills, then this is fine.

Reviews.Title: “not too sure”
Reviews.Author: Samyak M
Reviews.Content: nice cozy hotel right in the centre of all that is happening around. BUT - found it a bit pricey considering they do not have a porter, there are no lifts, the staircase is steep and narrow, rooms are slightly bigger than the bed!! the location also was slightly slimey (narrow roads, can't see anything clearly, and feels like you are in dark alleys). the tv was small (though sufficient for the room that small) and hardly had any english channels. on the flip side - the staff was friendly, everything was just around the corner, the furnishing looked ancient but then was well maintained. not too sure whether i would want to go back to this place - as i was expecting a bit more from it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: visitors50
Reviews.Content: We were put on the fourth floor of the annexe...no-one to help with the bags, room shabby with two single beds pushed together, furniture tatty and we opened the bathroom door to be greeted with badly cracked floor and wall tiles, bidet tap continually running and wouldn't turn off, sink taps continually running and wouldn't turn off, the tops fell off when we tried to turn them. The bath was grotty with no shower curtain or wall fixing, just a rusty shower head in the bath. Didn't see a smoke detector in room and were very concerned that the only was out from the fourth floor if there was a fire was down several flights of carpeted stairs with a wooden handrail in parts and walls traditionally decorated with fabric paricularly as the lights were on a sensor and when we left the room the stairs were in total darkness and we couldn't locate the switches. What would happen in the event of a fire? We refused to stay in the room or the annexe but could not be moved till the following day.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Enemark
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, nice room ... what more do you need? Everything is just around the corner - or at least you can go anywhere in Venice from just around the corner. Breakfast is included - so you can leave the hotel in the morning and be ready to explore this great city!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel we have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Lee_AnneCanberra
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dirty, dingy and hardly rates as a hotel at all. We would have moved to alternative accommodation if it were available despite our travel agent having prepaid for it. Do yourself a favour and look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing is location...”
Reviews.Author: milkute
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, my husband had to carry 2 luggages up the stairs as there is no porter.. after we checked in, one of the maids was called to show our room, which was terrible. Tobacco smells, chipped decor and even more horrifying bathroom- only one person can move in there. after we refused to take this room, we were taken to much better room. It was better decorated, had a small hallway, much bigger bathroom. Breakfast is horrible, no eggs, meat or cheese, which is available at all hotels I have been. Cleaners clean rooms very poorly, mainly take the rubbish out and make bed. Throughout our 4 day stay, our sheets haven't been changed at all. There is no common sense things added like ironer or tea bar. If you want your things to be ironed pay from 3 to 7 euros. would not recommend this to anyone. P.S. dont get caught on the pictures at their official website, we haven't seen any of this!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt leave fast enough”
Reviews.Author: Ngb604
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival two well dressed italian men were exiting the hotel as we arrived. Although we could not speak italian it was clear that they were telling us "oh no" This "hotel" lacked in everything except location and quiet. We were so uncomfortable that we forego our third prepaid night and went to Al ponte Mocenigo for 40+ euros less and 4 star service and quality. Do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worn out hotel”
Reviews.Author: soccerdude1982
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because if its location to San Marco. We should have stayed else were, the location is about the only thing this hotel has going for it. They stuck us in the auxiliary part of the hotel and it was horrible. The walls and sheets were stained. There had to be about a dozen squished mosquitoes on the wall. Who wants to stay in a room with bug guts on the wall. The shower was just a bath tub and a faucet. Save some money and stay else were.

Reviews.Title: “A Traditional European Hotel Done Right”
Reviews.Author: patatornado
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lux is a fantastic little respite from the normal "hostel" routine. We had a double bedroom with a balcony (i think they only have one room with a balcony, we just got lucky) that looked out at the Doge's Palace. At night we could hear gondoliers singing as they brought passengers up behind the palace. It is located just east of Palazzo San Marco and is in a great neighborhood of restaurants and wine bars, as well as super close to several main vaporetto stops. Our room was of average size (small compared to most american rooms) but it was just fine for us. The bathroom functioned without a hangup (which can be hit/miss in Europe) and the cleaning staff made our bed and changed our linens every night. There is wireless internet available for standard charges (1 euro for an hour) but we never used it. There was a septic tank outside of our window (luckily we were 5 floors up) that occasionally smelled not so great, but nothing worth complaining about. The complimentary Breakfast (8-10) was great, each morning I had a hand-made cappuccino from a great staff member, yogurt and croissant with honey (various other spreads were available, including hazelnut and chocolate)

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: EmmaLouise10-71
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend this hotel. We were on the 4th floor with no lift and struggled with our cases. The last flight of stairs was so narrow we could barely fit through and my husband hit his head a number of times. Our bed was like sleeping on a slab of concrete and we waited on the stairs for 20mins one morning because we could not fit in the breakfast room, very dated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: GregKo
Reviews.Content: Well hidden in a tiny street, the Lux hotel is just a minute walk from the vaporetto stop and about 3 minutes walk from Piazza San Marco, great location. The hotel in very charming, nicely decorated room. Be aware that there is no lift if it's a problem for you and that the last set of stairs is really really narrow. The free breakfast is indeed pretty terrible but well...I really like this place and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Venetian-stlye rooms, but terrible "free" breakfast”
Reviews.Author: guepardo_lento
Reviews.Content: Classic Venetian styled rooms in red and yellow. Rooms are small, but that's OK it was sufficient for the two of us. We were outside walking all day and we really didn't travel to Venice to sit inside the hotel. There is a small refrigerator and a hairdryer for convenience, but interestingly no clock. Maybe they feel that you throw away the clock when on vacation, who knows. The bathroom shower has an interesting door, in that it didn't really function the way they intended, and a bit of water pools on the bathroom floor. Nonetheless, this is minor point. It was clean and relatively quiet, and warm. My problem is with their terrible breakfast. Even for my Italian friend (many Italians don't eat a breakfast in the manner Americans or the British for example) thought the breakfast was terrible. The coffee (Italiano espresso) was wretched, and the croissants were bland and tasted like cardboard. The provide cheap cornflakes and sugary, bad tasting cheap orange juice. I don't expect much for a breakfast, but this was really a low point of the hotel as I think they are being cheap and buying poor quality food and serving to their guests to save money. Do yourself a favor if you stay here, buy food at a pastry shop or one of the markets (the co-op, or billa) and eat it in your room. Note that the restaurants will charge you an arm and leg for "traditional" British/Americano/French breakfast. We stayed for 4 days at this hotel and we stopped going to their terrible breakfast and began going to a bar half-block away on calle Rasse-near the intersection of the alley for the hotel. The location of the hotel is OK if you want to be near San Marco, but at night it is really dead. We walked at night to San Croce and other neighborhoods to get out of the epicenter of tourism (San Marco) and find less expensive bars, osteria, trattorias etc. Don't let people tell you that "nothing" goes on at night in Venice. This is not exactly true, as many of the young people who work in Venice hang out at night in the smaller neighborhoods. Don't expect big clubs, but rather small places to drink.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly staff. Would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: pensterspen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days over New Year 2010 and had a wonderful stay. We had 2 rooms between our family of 4. Both rooms were very nicely decorated with en suite facilities (1 room had an outside terrace). The decor was tasteful without being garish, and yet fitting to the opulence of Venice. The rooms were at the top of the building, with quite a few stairs but that was ok for us. The staff were always friendly and helpful. We tried our best to speak as much Italian as we could muster (which wasn't much...), and they seemed to appreciate our efforts. Yes the hotel is down an alley, but that does not detract from it at all. It is very well placed for restaurants, bars, St Marks Square, etc. The breakfast was simple with yogurt, coffee/tea, juice, brioche and was what I would expect from a continental breakfast. We hope to stay in Venice again in the future and I will definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: effaysia
Reviews.Content: Not the most modern or in the best condition, but the friendly service and location. Stayed there twice and had a gorgeous view from our hotel room every time. It really is only a 2.5 Star Hotel, but who stays in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is average every way you look at it BUT location is Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Exploring_ss
Reviews.Content: Ok so this hotel was just ok but it had a great location. Breakfast, which was included, was terrible - you get cereal and lousy coffee- but enough about that, just have breakfast at one of the dozens of little cafe's in the area and you're set. It definitely could have been cleaner - they did change the sheets and towels daily but the comforters looked like they hadn't been washed - ever. If you look at the pictures of the room, that's it - it looks just like that, simple and small but practical. We slept well, no noise or disruption and they had air conditioning, which is key in July in Italy. But you can't beat the location. It is right near the canal and a 5 minute walk to Saint Marcs Square and close to pretty much anything else; gondola service, restaurants, water taxi, etc. I considered it a good value solely based on the location. But the facts are you only sleep at your hotel and you can eat elsewhere - I just would have preferred it to be a little cleaner to feel more comfortable but we made do.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: JohnnoNZ
Reviews.Content: I'm fairly easy to please but this place just seemed to irritate me. This was my first time to Venice so take this review as you see it. I haven't visited any other hotels in this city so maybe some of the things I mention are the norm. I am comparing to other European hotels we stayed at during our honeymoon. Firstly, the location is excellent, right in the heart of Venice and very close to the Plaza San Marco. Thumbs up there. We were in the main building and didn't even know about the "annex" building down the street until we were chatting with another couple at breakfast one morning so can't really comment about that, but everyone takes breakfast at the main building Lobby. There is no elevator so you have to take the narrow and fairly steep stairs to whatever floor you get put on. And don't expect help with your luggage either. Our room itself was OK but our bathroom was a bit run-down with rusted shower fittings and you couldn't shut off the bath tap completely when you turned it to the shower. The room was a bit stuffy I think maybe there was an issue with our air-con but I'm not 100% sure. Rather than bother complaining we just spent more time out and about. No coffee / tea making facilities in the room. There is a safe in the room. I found the service a bit on the flat side but was warned to expect this from the more budget hotels in heavily crowded tourist areas. Internet - There is WiFi available but only in the restaurant/Lobby/waiting area, and this will set you back an extra 10 Euros for 24h. Breakfast was basic but enough to survive on. The waitress serving ours seemed to be constantly grumpy, which although I find this amusing, others may not. The issue with breakfast is getting a table. The seating area is tiny and can seat maybe 6 couples more or less. Also beware if you want a coffee or tea outside breakfast hours you will get stung ~4 Euros. Overall I'm not terribly impressed with this hotel and I won't use it again.

Reviews.Title: “We got what we expected”
Reviews.Author: aoziemann
Reviews.Content: We read reviews and booked a two night stay in a Quad room-only in annex- on the day of travel to Venice. The location was out of the way but not too hard to find. We knew that we were in the annex but up only one flight of stairs. It was HOT in July but the AC did OK by the time we got back to the room from the evening. The bath was clean and adequate. the beds we passable for two nights but wouldn't want to sleep on them for any longer. the staff was a bit gruff and the breakfast for lodgers of the annexx was a few doors down in another building. The offerings for breakfast were good but the room was on the warm side. We named our room the BLUE room.

Reviews.Title: “Get Reservations in the MAIN Hotel”
Reviews.Author: justhomeCincinnati
Reviews.Content: Like many others, we were very unhappy with our stay at the Lux. We also ended up in the "annex" in a tiny room barely big enough to hold our beds. When I complained, I was told it was OUR FAULT because we had not requested the "main" hotel. I asked for a reduction in price, but was refused. So, if you are going, be sure that you specifically request a room in the primary hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the 2-star annex unless they cut you a deal”
Reviews.Author: DocWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Venice is expensive. Period. There is a lot of mediocrity out there...if you want to enjoy yourself, I wouldn't recommend this place. Here is my beef: The hotel has an annex around the corner (2-star) but gets away with renting rooms at 3-star prices. I didn't stay in the main space, and maybe it is OK. I stayed at the tippy top of the annex...5 flights with no lift. There was no one available to help with bags on the way out.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Murraya
Reviews.Content: The room was in another building down the street from the hotel. We had to carry our luggage up several stairs with no help. The room was nothing fancy. We were glad it was for only 1 night. The only positive things about the hotel is that they let us store our luggage for several hours while we explored Venice and the location. We stayed in other 3 star hotels in Italy that were considerably better. Not worth the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position - no lift or porter.”
Reviews.Author: FastHelen
Reviews.Content: OK I know that you have to pay an arm and a leg for a central hotel in Venice but if you do stay here and you have booked into the hotel make sure they don't try and palm you off into another building over the street. We were shown to a dodgy little room up four flights of stairs but on complaining managed to find us a room in the main hotel - up four flights of stairs again and no porter so you had to lug your suitcases. Other problem was that even though we had booked a three bed room the third bed was a fold up one which, at the price we were paying, was unexpected. However, the room we ended up in, although small and dark, was recently redecorated with a good bathroom. The breakfasts, in an extremely poky dining room, were the worst we had in Italy and that is saying something. The position, however, was great for sightseeing and, after all, that was why we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Manish08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lux hotel in early September 2008. It has a fantastic location but that is all that is going for it. TIny rooms (I guess it is the same with all venice hotels), tiny breakfast rooms, avg breakfast, safe (which is not working),. No bell Boy. Lugging luggage is really a pain on those narrow steps. Wouldnt recommend it and not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: delstone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 days at the end of May 2008 when it was quite warm in Venice. The positives is that the hotel has great location and the rooms are very tastefully decorated. Besides that our stay was uncomfortable with many small irritations. Firstly I had to literally drag one of our 18 Kg bags up 4 very narrow flights of stairs to room 142. No lift. The attendant who was my junior by about 20 years gave no indication that he will attend to both bags. If you do consider this hotel - avoid rooms 140 to 143 - they are located on the 3rd and 4th floors. The very cramped dining room (about 3 X 5 m) was on the 1st floor of a different building across the street. It had 4 or 5 very small tables squashed in and you could not move back your chair without inconveniencing someone else. The breakfast was the poorest of our tour to Paris, Rome, Florence and Venice. Only one type of cereal (corn flakes) and no ham or meat. The toilet in the dining room was blocked by a chair and out of order for the duration of our stay - so back to the room you go for some relief. The aircon in the room just scraped home at full tilt all the time. There is no bath and the shower head was broken and loose from the shower wall fittings. So you had to hold the shower thingy in one hand while showering. I reported this but nothing was done and I eventually tied the head to the fitting with some rope. I hate being negative in general but promised myself I will take the time to write this review. We did not have a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: JJFB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lux in April of 2008. Beautifully decorated and marble tiled hotel. The rooms were quite nice too. Excellent location only 1 block from St. Mark's Square. In a quiet side alley near stores and restaurants. The only problem was the lack of a lift or elevator. The breakfast tables were tiny, but the breakfast itself was decent with the regular parade of ham, cheese, cornetti, jellies, coffee and yogurt. You won't regret a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: piogold
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 1 minute from the boat/bus stop, 2 minutes from St Mark's Square (you can hear the bells but they're not intrusive). Room nice and warm, clean, and with decent bathroom. It was nice to have a safe and fridge / minibar, also a TV. If you can't manage thirty or so stairs you're in trouble, and our room was in a separate building 75 metres away, and the breakfast in another building again (though very close). The breakfast room was cramped and the breakfast itself was continental - rolls, croissants, cornflakes, yoghurts - but you could have as much as you wanted, and the waitress was happy to give top-ups of coffee. If you like four-star hotels the Lux isn't for you, but if you like quirky charm and value for money and a wonderfully convenient location then the Lux should be on your list.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Hotel disappointing”
Reviews.Author: walkermp
Reviews.Content: I had read the mixed reviews before going, so was a little trepidacious, but rooms were hard to come by during the time of our visit. The location of this hotel is fabulous, just off St. Marks and the waterfront, but very quiet. We were exhausted when we arrived after flying all night from the U.S. We got to the hotel and it was too early to check in, so they allowed us to leave our bags in the breakfast room near check-in. We found the desk staff to be quite terse and minimally helpful during our stay. The room that they initally took us to around the corner from the main building was unacceptable - I don't think it even had a window and it was only as big as the bed. I was so depressed, that we went to ask for another room. We were told quite rudely that the room was of the type we had reserved. She said they had one other - down 4 flights of stairs and back up another 4 in a third building. This room, although small, was a little better and had a tiny little cute balcony off of it. The bed was uncomfortable but the room was clean. The breakfast was minimal - the worst of any of our hotels in Italy. I definately hope to return to Venice, but not to the Lux.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: inneedofadventure
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel before and didn't write a review then for some reason. I like this hotel. it's in a great location for sight seeing. It's less than a minutes walk to St Marks square. There's two seperate parts to this hotel and i've now stayed in both. This time i was up in the god's on the fourth floor. Thank god i was fit. There's no elavator so you have to carry your bags to your rooms even on the 4th floor. Not good for elderly people to be up there i'd say for sure. Like a typical venetian hotel the rooms aren't huge. But they're clean and comfortable. I had a bath, a small bath with shower included and i was grateful for the soak it provided after all the walking i did. I'm 5" 1 so if i say it's small it gives you an idea. I also had an outside patio area with table and chairs which i would have loved in the summer time. No tea or coffee making facilities in the room but you can get them in the bar. Breakfast is in the breakfast/ bar room on floor 1 and consists of crossiants, rolls, various preserves. Cornflakes. Fruit juice and various hot drinks. Everyone is friendly and helpful at the hotel. On your last day they will store your luggage for free until you need to make your way to the airport which is a god send as the last thing you want to do is cart it around all day with you. I'll stay at this hotel again in future purly because of it's location it's ideal and so easy to find. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: amgoingthere
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The stairs were exactly as we saw on the intenet which was comforting as we had not booked over the net before. The reception was vey helpfull. Our room was typical venetian very nice, a bit dark but clean. We found the bed a bit hard and in the early hours you can hear the early workers and bin collection going on, but overall it's ok for 3 nights. Basic breakast, small rolls and coiussants, spread cheese and chocolate spread! coffee,tea,juice. I think the location is perfect, easy to find on arrival after getting of the water bus. a good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay - Great location with plenty of stairs”
Reviews.Author: Gypsywillow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as they say, comprising of a number of different buildings within close proximity to each other. The room was quaint Venetian and small with a double bed. We were 3 flights of stairs up and in a building around the corner to the check-in. It's very close to Saint Marco Square and we were pleased with breakfast and the location of the hotel. The directions on their website are exact and will get you to them with no problems. It's surrounded by restaurants so you have plenty of choice. Boats/ water buses etc are at the end of the street. It's great!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: stefoley
Reviews.Content: What can I say. Loved it! Travelled with My mother of 65 who wanted to see Venice and took her there for her retirement. We arrived at around 11pm and the Venice that time of night is pretty dead and dark, the rain didn't help either!!. The directions on the website were fantastic and got off at the water bus stop near San Marcos and like others have said it is really in the middle of everyting. Took no more that a 2 minute walk to the hotel where we met very friendly staff. The room was fine, nothing too plush but it was very comfortable, clean and quiet. Ensuite had fresh new towels every day, was spotless clean and loads of hot water. The breakfast room is very small and would sit around 15 people, so you might have to try your luck once or twice to get a seat. Breakfast itself is basic but enough to get you through to lunch. The real charm with the hotel is its location. So close to the major water bus stops and walking distance to everywhere is amazing. Basically its behind San Marco! This allowed us to stroll around, see some sites but head back to rest or chill out if we needed to. The staff were very helpful with regards to the places to see and go, excellent english speakers in the hotel. All in all, having met other travellers how stayed in much higher class hotels, it would seem that the trade off between location and luxury was well well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Teacher1LasVegas
Reviews.Content: Great location - very close to San Marco Square. We stayed in a room around the corner from the main entrance to the hotel. It felt like our own private apartment. If you can't walks stairs, stay away from this hotel. The room was nicely decorated and the bed was comfortable. There was central A/C which you control in your room. In fact it got sooooo cold, in the room, we had to turn it down. The breakfast was o.k. A great location - 1 block from the San Marco Square boat dock and 3 blocks from the Alilaguna boat that takes you to the Venice Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: brit1222
Reviews.Content: The Lux Hotel is very well situated and despite the compact size of bedroom and bathroom we had a comfortable stay and it was good value. Room 441 was up 5 flights of narrow stairs at the rear of the annexe building and was very quiet. The decor was Venetian style â€“fabric on the walls etc. Breakfasted at 8 am thanks to comments here- queues formed 8.15 onwards. To get to hotel from bus station look for the Vaparetto boat berth- it is alongside and below the bus station- The bus station is the Piazzale Roma stop of the Vaparetto. Get tickets from the ticket booth in the bus station square and decide NOW which pass duration you need. The one hour pass will cost 6 Euros to get to the hotel from here. If staying in Venice for 3 or more days you will probably be walked out and need a restful day on the Vaparettos visiting the other islands or just cruising up and down the Grand Canal, so consider getting a longer pass. Visit the web site before leaving UK. (www.actv.it) Take Vaparetto boat number 1 which goes to S Zaccaria where Hotel Lux is located. Disembark at S Zaccharia and stand on the quay and you can see the Hotel Danieli. Your alley is alongside it- Calle D Rasse and Hotel Lux is number 4541/4542. (Whenever catching the Vaparetto, check which direction and route it is covering. We caught Number 82 which also goes to S Zaccaria but ours went around the lagoon edge- more interesting is the Grand Canal route). Note the boats can get hot and crowded unless you get a seat outside at the front. We rode on a gondola from one of the back street canals rather than from the main front and the prices quoted were 50E early on a damp morning and up to 100E when busy on a sunny day. For our 80E (â€œ30- 40 minutesâ€�) we were taken onto the Grand Canal to the Rialto bridge and then had a good tour of the back canals and were on board for 30 minutes in total and got a little bit of commentary. Price is for the boat- not each -which seat up to 6. Top tip. Take your travel kettle, cups, teabags etc Venice is expensive. Tip 2 The touristic menu can be good but you may have to request it. Soup was good, Pasta al Forno (lasagne) was huge and tasty despite being only 1% meat, Liver Venetian Style excellent, Veal escalope good, mixed fish (nibbles) dire and should be left in the freezer (though some other places offered fish fillet), so ask what it consists of. Top Tip 3 Use your wheeled lightweight suit case.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Hostel Feel”
Reviews.Author: taylorm_g
Reviews.Content: NOT WRITTEN BY HOTEL - EXTREMELY HONEST Hotel Lux is two buildings: one to check in, the other to live in. You might open the door to your room and think it a broom closet. Just walk in a little further and you'll find a rather clean bathroom. This is where you'll be staying. Luckily, you're in Venice. So if you're going to stay in this small hotel room, you're in the wrong city. It's a wee room, that feels more like a hostel, given its decor. The staff seemed clueless at times but were adequate. did not speak very good english. The breakfast was poor. But the location is basically next to St. Mark's Square. Excellent location. You're probably in Venice to walk and experience the city, not the hotel room anyway, but when you do return to your room, it's not the most exhilarating experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Clean...Nothing Else”
Reviews.Author: dranzo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite charming with its small side street entrance and beautiful mirror and wood lined stairway to the front desk. It is an easy 3 minute walk to the vaparetto, St. Marks, internet point, and many restaurants and cafes. Room was small but clean and the chamber service was very good. However I found the staff to be unhelpful. The steep steps up to the front desk and then to the rooms (no elevator) came with no assistance from the staff. We all lugged our suitcases up (and down) right in front of them, including our 13 and 9 year old girls. No help with recommendations for dinner, and no help in confirming flight reservations. Expect to be on your own once you get your key. Breakfast was served for only 2 hours, starting at 8 am, so it was crowded each day with a waiting line, and the place wasn't even at full vacancy. Boring breakfast. Price was not great given the time of year (Nov.). There are tons of places to stay in this area so its great location is not unique. Though satisfied with the stay overall, I will stay elsewhere next time as there is nothing compelling about the Lux.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: convivace
Reviews.Content: I had friends that stayed there and thought it was very nice. However, my experience was the same as some of the other negative reviews. We entered an lovely lobby to register and then we were taken outside, down the way and around the corner to another building. The room was dank, low ceilinged and almost claustraphobic. We had stayed at 2 star hotels in Rome and Florence for nearly half the price and they were both better. After complaining about the malfunctioning air conditioning several times, we were moved to a different room the next day. It was substantially better. It seems the quality of rooms varies wildly. I wouldn't risk booking a room here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lux passes test!”
Reviews.Author: Algoesonholiday
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 rooms for 3 nights after a lot of research, including TripAdvisor comments: we are 4 couples and go somewhere different every year. Within a mixed budget, this was spot on for price and location: but what would it be like? Well it ticked the boxes really: it was bang on in the heart of Venice, the rooms were more than adequate and the bathrooms quite good overall. A couple of the rooms had some problems like faulty showers but these were lived with and dealt with where possible. Breakfast is quaint and cramped. Cant handle disabled or those unable to climb 3 flights of stairs. For the price and location, I would recommend: if you want pure luxury try the Cipriani (but for 4 times the price!) Our groups motto is: reasonable, clean, value for money hotel rooms, but DONT skimp on the food and drink! So we didn't. Hotel Lux: friendly, clean, reasonable price, good value, great location

Reviews.Title: “Good location-No problems”
Reviews.Author: hydepark1998
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lux has an excellent location to stay at while in Venice. This was our first of 3 hotels and first time in Italy. Everything worked out fine. Right in the heart of everything, but the side streets have great cafes and shops. Internet cafe right down the street. Room was small, but clean. We did walk up 3 flights of stairs, but they carried our luggage up and down for us. Breakfast area was small, but sufficient. Other reviews say something about having a room in another building. We didn't experience this and didn't hear of anyone complaining while we were there. The location was excellent-right next to a water taxi stop. Easy to get around all over Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Hotel Lux”
Reviews.Author: Cruising-along
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at Hotel Lux before taking a cruise from Venice. We were very happy with the hotel and had no problems at all. Since we had done extensive research on hotels prior to our trip, we knew that Hotel Lux does not have an elevator, so we weren't surprised or disappointed about that. When we arrived at the hotel late at night from Rome, the young man at the front desk offered, without being asked, to help take our bags up the 3 flights of stairs to our room, which we accepted gladly. Our room was good size, clean and quiet. It had everything we needed. The continental breakfast which is served in a breakfast room was very good and plentiful. We had coffee, juice, yogurt, cereal, croissants, rolls, and capuccino etc. made to order. All the staff at Hotel Lux were very friendly and helpful, and you can't beat the location. In the rush when checking out, we left behind a painting we had bought in Paris. We e-mailed the hotel the next morning, and got an immediate response. They held onto the painting for us, assuring us that it was in good hands. They sent the painting to our home promptly when we asked, 2 weeks later when we returned home from the cruise. We couldn't be happier with Hotel Lux and our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away, 3 stars are false”
Reviews.Author: LSSIWEK
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks in Tuscany, Rome and Venice. All my other hotels were great. The Hotel Lux was terrible. First, the lobby is in one building. You register, and they tell you to go around the corner, into another building. We were on the third floor with no elevator. I had my room reserved for four months and I can't believe I had the latest reservation to have the worst room. I have a heart condition and literally could only go to my room at night because I couldn't get up and down the stairs numerous times. Since we had been traveling for a bit, we had a good amount of luggage. In the morning when we went for breakfast we went back to the hotel lobby because there was a restaurant set up literally right next to the desk. We were told the breakfast for the hotel was down the alley and into a third building. The room wasn't bigger than 12X12. Not sure who was eating in the hotel lobby of the Lux, but it wasn't the Lux residents! Our room was small and that wasn't a concern and the location near St. Marks Square was good but I would never stay there and I knew I would return to write this review to alert others.

Reviews.Title: “What a run around! I would recommend against prepaying for a hotel room!”
Reviews.Author: Sunpoppy
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my sister and mother through Italy. I booked only 3 and 4 star hotels for our trip. I booked the Lux two months prior to our travels and prepaid for the nights at the hotel's request. We arrived in Venice and proceeded to the Lux. The lobby seemed acceptable and the location was as described. The woman at reception informed me that there was a problem with our room and we were being moved to a nearby hotel. We were taken across a piazza to the Hotel Rio by a "porter". The Rio had signage that consisted of a piece of cardboard with the name Hotel Rio and two stars written in red crayon. (see picture) The room was a disaster, smelly, dark, small and the third bed consisted of a camp-style cot, complete with coil springs holding an inch thin mattress pad on the canvas topper. Bedbugs came immediately to mind. Back in the lobby, I reiterated that this was not acceptable. I suggested that they try to accomodate us in a three star hotel and indicated that the nearby "Locanda Al Leon" would be accptable as I had stayed there on prior trips. More phone conversation continued and we were told that there was no other hotel and we would have to stay at the Hotel Rio. I then walked back to the Hotel Lux to speak directly with the women in reception again. As I opened the door, she said that the porter had made a mistake and taken us to the wrong hotel. (Why then was the room set up for a triple at the Rio?). We were then taken to the hotel Tiepolo which was charming and the staff very sweet and professional. However, I have no doubt that had we not had a slight understanding of the language and been firm yet not angry, that we would have found ourselved in the sewer hotel. Although I've never had this happen before in Italy, it was dissapointing even just this once.

Reviews.Title: “This place was very nice”
Reviews.Author: sharmac
Reviews.Content: After a disaster and a half in Rome it was a delite to arrive at this place. We were a little surprise to find we got checked in in one building but walked around the corner to another building but none the less the rooms were very nice (small) but very very nice, the staff helpful and breakfast was great. We were very very close to everything (note, if your going for the first time you need catch the water taxi to San Zaccheria). If we go back to venice we will stay here for sure, without a doubt. Thanks Hotel Lux.

Reviews.Title: “Beware this hotel's sleazy practices!”
Reviews.Author: OlderTraveler
Reviews.Content: I am planning a trip to Italy in May 2006. In early March, I booked 2 rooms at this hotel for 3 nights in late May through an internet booking agent. The terms stated that the credit card number was needed to guarantee the reservation, but no charges would be made until the date of arrival. Further, there would be no cancellation penalties if cancelled at least 3 days before the scheduled check in. For a variety of reasons, my group decided to go to a different hotel in Venice and I cancelled the reservations at Hotel Lux 6 days after the initial reservation, and more than 2 months before our trip. Imagine my surprise to find a charge of $320.00 from Hotel Lux on my credit card! I am now forced to dispute this charge with my credit card company - and my trip is still 2 months away!! If you make a reservation with this hotel, make sure it's the one you want, because you are going to get hosed otherwise!

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: sazza60
Reviews.Content: Very reasonably priced for Venice! Very convenient for boats and st marks square. We were in an annexe just around the corner, with 3 rooms with own breakfat room. Double room, good size, clean and newly decorated. Bathroom newly fitted, vry smart and warm. Friendly staff. Childrens twin room a bit small, and 1 bed a put-u-up, but was fine for 3 nights. would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: calSheffieldEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights -clean friendly warm Ideal location Very near to waterbus stop from airport Quiet rooms Excellant value for money Will reccomend

Reviews.Title: “cute and nice”
Reviews.Author: lihpa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel lux in venice after reading reviews on tripadvisor. Prices in venice were a fortune so we found this one and took a chance. Hotel had a great location near the water taxis and was easy to find. The staff was friendly and the room was charming. The one caveat is that the hotel has no elevator so bringing baggage up the steps can be difficult but worth the effort. Room was nice and clean and hotel had small area for breakfast. Price was great. My wife was worried when I booked hotel but loved after we got there.

Reviews.Title: “Really friendly”
Reviews.Author: weirdpie
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Lux on the basis of reviews we had seen on tripadvisor and we're glad that we did. The hotel, although small, was very smart and clean. The location couldnt have been any better - about 3 minutes from Piazza San Marco - close enough to be able to pop back and forth during the day but far enough to avoid the noise of the crowds at night. The room was small but very comfortable and well equipped and breakfast, although simple, was filling. The best thing about the Lux however was the staff. So friendly and always willing to help with a genuine smile. My girlfriend became quite ill during our stay and the staff insisted on accompanying us both to the hospital in the pouring rain, to make sure we didnt get lost and explain things when we arrived. We wouldnt hesitate in recommending The Lux to anyone, and would definately stay there again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but very nice”
Reviews.Author: TallyCrew
Reviews.Content: The plusses: location, location, location! Less than five minutes from San Marco Square, water taxis, shops, the Venice Lagoon. The rooms were clean and the staff friendly. The negatives: stairs, stairs, stairs. Don't stay here if you can't climb several flights of steep stairs. The breakfast is ok...bread and cheese, but great coffee. Virtually no water pressure in the shower. We had a pleasant stay here, but would proabably look elsewhere if we go back to Venice.
